intro: Leucopogon carinatus, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in open woodlands and rocky areas. Its small, white or pink flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, dark berries in the fall. Leucopogon carinatus is often found in the Appalachian Mountains and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
